sn23.11:4.2: Seated to one side, Venerable Rādha said to the Buddha:
sn23.11:4.3: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘Māra’.
sn23.11:4.5: “Rādha, form is Māra, feeling is Māra, perception is Māra, choices are Māra, consciousness is Māra.
sn23.11:4.6: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple becomes disillusioned with form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness.
sn23.11:4.9: When freed, they know ‘it is freed’.
sn23.11:4.10: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”
